New Records: Kwadwo Duah scored his first international goal in Switzerland's 3-1 win over Hungary.
Michel Aebischer also scored his first international goal, doubling Switzerland's lead with a curling shot from outside the box.
Key Match Events: Switzerland took an early 1-0 lead through Kwadwo Duah's goal after 12 minutes.
Michel Aebischer doubled the lead with a superb strike just before halftime.
Hungary's Barnab√°s Varga scored an own goal in the 66th minute but Switzerland maintained control.
Breel Embolo sealed the win with a late goal after a Hungarian defensive error.
Pre-Game Insights: Switzerland aimed to make a strong tournament start after a shaky qualifying campaign.
Switzerland's coach Murat Yakin emphasized tactical awareness and strength in their game plan.
Post-Match Reflections: Swiss coach Murat Yakin praised the team's tactical execution and opponent's mistakes.
Hungary's coach Marco Rossi acknowledged their poor first-half performance and took responsibility.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at RheinEnergieSTADION in Cologne, Germany.
Switzerland's Line-Ups included key players like Granit Xhaka and Breel Embolo.
Hungary's young star Dominik Szoboszlai made his European Championship debut as captain.
Others: The match was a crucial opener for both teams in Group A of Euro 2024.
